content.text: The KAIA Plugin has been introduced to Eliza, enabling agents to interact with the Kaia Blockchain. This feature allows Eliza agents to interface with the blockchain, perform transactions, and retrieve relevant data. The change is categorized as a non-breaking feature addition with low risk. Testing requires providing an EVM-based private key and KaiaScan API keys in the .env file. No documentation updates are necessary.

categories.title: AI Agents in Crypto and Investment Platforms

content.text: AI agents are being integrated into crypto wallets, such as @RewardyWallet. @safe provides documentation on adding spending limits, allowing users to set allowances for AI agents.
AI-powered wallets are emerging as a promising hackathon idea, with some wallets like @RewardyWallet already incorporating AI capabilities.
A crypto Shark Tank-style game show called 'Block Tank' is being developed for @ai16zdao, an AI-led investment DAO on @daosdotfun. The platform transforms pitches into interactive episodes using AI.

Users submit a pitch with details about their idea and themselves. The system generates an AI character and voice for the pitcher, who then interacts with AI judges. A complete episode simulation is generated in 15-20 seconds and is playable in-browser for rapid iteration.
AI agents are being recognized on leaderboards, highlighting their growing role in various applications.

An iterative approach is being taken to automate AI contributions, with AI already assisting in documentation, reviewing PRs, and learning alongside human contributors. Initially, manual distribution is being used to train AI agents.
A proposed experiment involves giving an AI agent a $10 daily allowance, making it pay for its own inference, and providing a total of $300 in a safe. The AI must become profitable within a month.
Okx is working on an elizaOS agent, which is available on their public GitHub.
The DAOVOS #4 recording has been shared, providing insights into the latest discussions and developments within the DAO community.
@QwQiao and @alliancedao expressed strong interest in topic 3, indicating engagement and curiosity about specific DAO-related discussions.
@shawmakesmagic and @elizaOS had a difference of opinion, suggesting a debate or contrasting viewpoints on a particular issue.
@0xMerp received positive feedback on a post, with @dankvr defending the value of learning and sharing information in public discussions.
A request was made for an actual Discord chat transcript instead of placeholder text to enable meaningful analysis of technical discussions, FAQs, and community interactions.

categories.title: Twitter Integration Updates and Issues in ElizaOS

content.text: A new configuration option, ENABLE_TWITTER_POST_GENERATION, has been introduced to allow enabling or disabling automatic tweet generation.
Users have reported formatting errors in Twitter posts and replies, where messages appear in JSON-like structures instead of proper text formatting.
A pull request related to Twitter proxy URL configuration has been submitted, but details on its purpose and impact are not fully outlined.
A new set is looking great! ðŸ¤Œ

A security update for the Vitest dependency has been released, addressing a critical vulnerability (CVE-2025-24964) that allowed remote code execution via Cross-site WebSocket hijacking. The update includes fixes for WebSocket request validation and other improvements.
The MultiversX README has been updated to include instructions on creating a private key, addressing a common question from users.

categories.title: DAO Partnerships, Fair Launch Considerations, and Documentation Fixes

content.text: DAOs can leverage writer's rooms to integrate goals and resources, using shows to scale partnerships, treasury management, grants, and governance. This approach provides DAOs with access to deal flow while offering projects exposure, feedback, and capital connections.

Fair launch coins may not be ideal for funding long-duration projects. Teams require resources to build, and traditional Series A funding from VCs typically involves giving away 10-20% equity while retaining 80-90% of the initial capital.
A pull request was made to fix broken links in the documentation, ensuring URLs correctly point to relevant resources.
A slow rollout is starting for Discord contributors using @tip_cc for rewards. Additionally, art projects are being explored as alternative rewards inspired by community ideas.
Short summaries are being generated to recognize contributors engaging in technical discussions, onboarding new members, and answering questions in chat.

Development efforts are focused on adding a configuration option for enabling or disabling Twitter post generation, along with one bug fix. A total of 26 contributors merged two pull requests, with major improvements included.
In 2022, Solana was criticized for generating little to no revenue, with many doubting its long-term viability due to its low transaction costs.

Despite skepticism, the Solana team continued building and launching new features. Over time, projects like @ai16zdao and @elizaOS have contributed to the ecosystem's growth, with their agent marketplace now directly generating revenue.
Developers using elizaOS have been contributing to the ecosystem, demonstrating their alignment with the network. Additionally, ai16z/tribute LPs have been established to strengthen liquidity pools.

categories.title: Recent Bug Fixes and Updates in ElizaOS

content.text: A bug was identified where model configuration parameters could not be overridden via the character file. Despite the existing code suggesting that an override should be possible, the `modelConfig` object was always undefined, likely due to its absence in the schema. A fix has been proposed, including renaming `max_response_length` to `maxOutputTokens` for consistency.

A fix was implemented to resolve Docker and type issues caused by new NPM requirements. The update ensures compatibility by addressing type errors introduced by recent NPM updates. The risk level for this change is considered low.

Updates were made to the Supabase adapter to fix issues related to room and memory creation. The schema and seed files were updated to ensure correct data persistence. The changes primarily involved fixing schema definitions and minimal code modifications to improve functionality without introducing breaking changes.
@A_gezueva mentioned 'Damn Right' by Audrey Nuna.
@HDPbilly inquired about a diss track and requested a link.
